reviewText:
Wanderjahr is a very nice “clicker” RPG. The graphics are very beautiful and seems inspired by games such as MapleStory. Gameplay consists of managing a roster of heroes during battles and swapping them out of tactical necessity when needed, as you can only have 4 on the battlefield simultaneously.

The heroes attack automatically, and you are in control of item/spell use and switching out heroes when needed. In between battles you spend the gold and stars you earned from killing monsters on buying healing items, technology/spells, and upgrades for your heroes. Unfortunately, there are no skill trees for heroes which was something I would have liked to see and thus upgrades are completely linear.

Story-wise, the game was a bit on the weak side (you apparently have to read the plot from the menu?). Additionally, some heroes seemed more useful than others (the “thief” class hero doesn’t do much damage and only helps steal an inconsequential amount of gold per attack). However, I did enjoy the art style in this game and the animations were very smooth. Some levels were very challenging, including the first bossfight. I also enjoyed the soundtrack of this game. Overall, I did enjoy the game for the few hours I’ve played it and would recommend picking it up on a sale or when more content/updates get added.

Disclaimer: Key was provided by developer for a review. This did not influence my review in any way.

reviewText:
My Impression:I was intrigued by the description and that it claimed to be a JRPG. This is far from the truth. The game is actually a clicking game in the clicking genre. If you have played any clickers such as: clicker heroes, sakura clicker, etc, you will notice the resemblence. It was a nice marketing tool to get me to buy the game because it said JRPG, but I will be asking for a refund.

Positive:+ New spin on a clicking game and innovative in the genre
+ A lot of different characters

Negatives:- Story is very bland, there's not much story anyways, it's just black screen with text on it; think star wars
- Gameplay gets old after 20 minutes
- PRICE. This would make a good mobile game for $0.99, but $8.99 is wayyyyyy too much. I would maybe pay $1.99 because of the trading cards.
- The only non clicking screen is the screen that looks like a mobile phone. This is where you can by items, look at team, etc. 90% of the game is spent on watching characters attack mobs without much interaction besides changing characters out
- Sound is terrible, the first boss especially
- Character customization is limited to just leveling them up, no weapons, armor, etc
- Artwork is very mobile style gamed as well, it's ok at first but as you progress in the game it gets very repetitive and bland. The characters you get are bland as well.

Pretty Poor Game: 3/10

Overall, this is game is a 3/10 and a one word description for it would be: BLAND. It would make a good mobile game and is definitely not worth $8.99. I'd probably buy it on sale for $0.99 for the trading cards, but I doubt it ever gets that cheap.

reviewText: I'm on the fence for this game, but I will barely grant it a thumbs up. Don't go into this thinking it is a JRPG like Secret Of Mana, Final Fantasy, or classics from the Playstation era, it isn't like that. Think more Advance Guardian Heroes, but remove the dialogue and talking, and make the battles completely automated so all you do is switch characters around to keep the team alive. It is fun, but only if you know what you are expecting. This is more of a real time Strategy game than a JRPG. If you know what to expect, than go ahead and get the game. I would recommend buying it during a Steam Sale if you decide to buy it.

reviewText:
I know what you're thinking. The visuals seem odd. The menus look like a mobile game port. Yes it is indeed 4:3.
If you past all of this you will find a neat game worth playing to forget all the little things in life. Such great examples being; Pain, misery, doubt, and most importantly why does the game look like a mobile game. Look past such things and you find a nice treat in a sea of endless dissapointment.

Pros:
>Gameplay is pretty neat
>Cute visuals reminicient of Maplestory without the cringeworthy xXNaruto_SauskeXx names everywhere
>It runs

Hit and miss:
>Sound
>HUD and menus are without a doubt cheap looking meant for giant fingers to press except this is a PC game

Cons:
>4:3

As far as I'm concerned, 10 bucks can be spent on games that look promising and end up being bug ridden garbage. Take a dive once in a while and you'll find yourself swimming in a jello pool(It's pretty sweet).

reviewText: This game is quite a good one. The combat system is rather fun, but it can get hard and very unfair at times, but with a bit of luck and the right strategy, you'll find you can get past most battles. I still haven't beaten it yet, but I'm determined to do so, as it's a lot of fun.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Even though the combat system is automated, you need to be very strategic about swapping your team member simultaneously. Boss fight is not easy and sometimes can be pretty challenging; therefore, you may have to grind and level up your characters before continuing further through the game. There are tons of character to recruit, and so many ways to form your favorite team party. Just try it, if you have played Final Fantasy 13 and could get along well with it's battle system, you may find this game attractive.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is my review for Wanderjahr, the Turn based JRPG.

Story:

The story is decent, it's about a team of people defending the world from invading monsters.

Graphics:

Visually, Wanderjahr is a pretty game, all the art is very crisp and well drawn. The menus and animations are all smooth and organized.

Gameplay:

The gameplay is fun and requires some strategy. It uses a turn based system with you managing switching players in and out. It's a little diffirent from a traditional JRPG, but it is challenging and fun.

Music:

The music is really good, it has a fast paced feel that really gets you into the game and ties it all together. It's soundtrack worthy in my opinion.

Overall:

Wanderjahr is a fun turn based JRPG that I would recommend to fans of the genre.

แต่ยังไงก็ขอตินิดนึงนะครับ เกมต่อๆไปจะได้ปรับปรุงแก้ไข
ขอฝากไว้สามเรื่องนะครับ
1.ระบบ
- ระบบการต่อสู้น่าเบื่อไปนิด เหมือนเกมมือถือเลยอ่ะครับ ดูๆแล้วทีมนี้น่าจะชอบแนวไฟนอล แฟนตาซีกัน ระบบพัฒนาตัวละคร ไอเทม และระบบต่อสู้ลองให้เป็นคล้ายๆแบบนั้นดูดีกว่าไหม?
2.ตัวหนังสือ
- อันนี้ที่ไม่ค่อยโอเคเลยคือในฉากอินโทร ฉากเนื้อเรื่อง ตัวหนังสือมันเลื่อนไปเอง -*- แล้วมันเลื่อนไวมาก ถ้าใครอ่านช้าๆหน่อยนี่ก็คือไม่ทันอ่ะครับ คราวหลังถ้าไม่ทำให้มันโชว์นานขึ้นก็ให้กดแล้วถึงจะเปลี่ยนข้อความเป็นชุดใหม่ดีกว่าไหม
- ภาษาอังกฤษดีใช้ได้เลยครับ แต่ยังมีบางจุดที่มีข้อผิดพลาดหรือยังฟังดูแข็งๆ อยู่ ผมขอเดานะว่าคนที่แปลเป็นอังกฤษนี่ต้องเรียนภาษาอังกฤษจากการเล่นเกมภาษามาเยอะแน่ๆ 55+ เทียบกับหลายๆคนแล้ว ถือว่าดีมากครับ แต่ก็ยังพัฒนาให้มันดีขึ้นได้อยู่
3.ภาพ
- เรื่องภาพ ขอชมคนวาดนะครับว่าวาดได้สวยมากกก แต่ ถึงจะสวยอย่างไร เกมเอ็นจิ้นมันแสดงชัดน่ะครับว่ากราฟฟิคแบบนี้คงจะเป็นเกมที่ใช้อะไรเก่าๆมาทำแน่ๆ ? เขาเรียกว่าเกมเอ็นจิ้นหรือเปล่า คือตรงนี้ต้องบอกเลยว่าถ้ามันเป็นเอ็นจิ้นตั้งแต่สมัยที่ผมคิด ฝ่ายอาร์ทคนนี้ฝีมืดีมากครับที่ทำให้ภาพมันออกมาดูดีได้ขนาดนี้ แต่อย่างไรเรื่องความเก่ามันก็ยังเห็นอยู่ครับ เกมหน้าเกมใหม่ก็ขอให้เป็นเทคโนโลยีใหม่ๆมาทำดีกว่านะครับ
- ดีไซน์ตัวละครและ ศัตรู มันดูไม่ผู้หญิงเกินไปก็ดูเด็กเกินไปครับ ถ้าต้องการจะเจาะกลุ่มเด็กผมก็ขอโทษด้วยที่ติข้อนี้ แต่ถ้าต้องการที่จะเจาะกลุ่มทุกเพศ ทุกวัย หรือวัยรุ่นขึ้นไป การออกแบบน่าจะทำให้มันดูสมจริง หรือดูมีความซีเรียสหนักแน่นมากกว่านี้ หรืออย่างน้อยเป็นอนิเมะวัยรุ่นมากกว่านี้ครับ ดีไซน์แบบปัจจุบันนี้เหมือนแรวเรื่องชูโกะคลาร่าไม่ก็พวกอนิเมะเด็กๆเลย
